answers.answer: hi there,In 2007 I vacationed in florida and visited the Springs went swimming with the manastees, had a great time.  When I got out of the water my vision was distorted. Almost like I still had water in my eyes.  When I returned home my optometrist he treated me for retinal edema.  Since then I have had three seperate epsode of distorted vision almost like you have the tv on a bad station and all you get is snow..  All the tests including MRI, cat scan, ultra sounds and brains stem test come back negitive.A week ago monday I woke up with the flickering in my perferial vision again.  It progressively got worse until I called my optometrist and family doctor.  A eye exam show no sign of any problem.  The diagonise was ocular migraine althought I have no headache.  I was perscribed migraine medication and although the debilitating flickering has dimmed with my eye open, when I close my eyes I can still see the flickering.   My family doctor has set up blood work to test for diabetes.

question: Hello,In December of 2002 I had developed a very bad strep throat to the extent that I could barely converse because my voice was nearly inaudible.  One night I had an extremely bad headache, worst headache in my life, forced myself to fall asleep, and immediately upon waking that morning I felt like I was in an awful nightmare because of the fact that my vision was way off.  Everything seems to flicker, constantly, and there seems to be an excessive amount of lighting around me.  I have also noticed throughout the 8 years of having this problem, one of my pupils is closer to my nose than the other, even though I never had that problem prior to this incident from happening.  It is truly debilitating as I have been put on anti-depressive and anti-anxiety meds which have obviously not address the underlining problem.  I have had an MRI, blood tests, eye exam, full physicals, everything comes up fine.  I have done some research on the net and a lot of my problems are very similar to derealization, depersonalization, although that usually happens to folks who use recreational drugs; I have never used drugs, smoked, or drank alcohol so I am still bewildered by this.  I am still convinced that it may indeed be an undetected stroke.  I am now 30 years old, male living in Florida.  Any insight to this matter would obviously be much appreciated.
title: flickering eyesight
